paragraphs: The world just got another glimpse of Kristen Stewart as Diana, Princess of Wales—and a replica of her iconic engagement ring takes center frame.

Production company Neon shared a picture of Stewart in costume for her new Pablo Larraín film, Spencer, on Instagram. In it, the actor wears a plaid coat, chunky ’80s-esque pearls, and a white turtleneck. Her hair is coiffed into Diana’s signature blonde cut, and her ring-clad hand is perfectly framed. “That sapphire,” the studio wrote in the caption.

It appears Stewart is recreating a look that Diana wore in a 1989 visit to Portsmouth, England. Now, Spencer takes place in December 1993—during the weekend in Sandringham when Princess Diana officially decided to divorce Prince Charles—so it’s unclear whether the outfit is donned during a flashback scene or whether the costume designers just decided to dress Stewart in a similar throwback style. Regardless, it’s quite the historical homage.
Diana, Princess of Wales on a visit to Portsmouth in January 1989. Julian Parker

The images arrive amid a fraught moment for the royal family. In early March, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s tell-all Oprah interview was watched by 17 million viewers in the United States alone—and subsequently dominated global headlines for days. Meanwhile, in February, The Crown won the 2021 Golden Globe for best television drama.

Spencer is expected to come out sometime this fall. “Spencer is a dive inside an emotional imagining of who Diana was at a pivotal turning point in her life,” Stewart has told Variety. “It is a physical assertion of the sum of her parts, which starts with her given name: Spencer. It is a harrowing effort for her to return to herself, as Diana strives to hold on to what the name Spencer means to her.”
